chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> forall m : nat, {n : nat | n < m /\ P n} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> ~ P n}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
lt_wf_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Set), (forall n0 : nat, (forall m : nat, m < n0 -> P m) -> P n0) -> P n
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}
le_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {m < n}
lt_eq_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n < m} + {n = m} + {m < n}
nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n < m} + {~ n < m}
gt_eq_gt_dec : forall n m : nat, {m > n} + {n = m} + {n > m}
le_not_lt : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> ~ m < n
not_lt : forall n m : nat, ~ n < m -> n >= m
le_lt_eq_dec : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> {n < m} + {n = m}
decide_right : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), ~ C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : ~ C, P (right H)) -> P decide
lt_S_n : forall n m : nat, S n < S m -> n < m
lt_n_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n < S m
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> {n : nat | x = Z.of_nat n}
le_lt_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> n < S m
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.nlt_ge : forall n m : nat, ~ n < m < -> m <= n
N.binary_rec : forall P : N -> Set, P 0%N -> (forall n : N, P n -> P (N.double n)) -> (forall n : N, P n -> P (N.succ_double n)) -> forall n : N, P n
decide_left : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : C, P (left H)) -> P decide
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
List.neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ List.Forall P l -> List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
List.Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {List.Forall P l} + {~ List.Forall P l}
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
List.Forall_Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {List.Forall P l} + {List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l}
List.Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {List.Exists P l} + {~ List.Exists P l}
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
le_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {~ n <= m}
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope

```coq
intros P H m.
induction m.
- right. intros n Hlt. exfalso. inversion Hlt.
- destruct (H m) as [HPm | HnPm].
  + left. exists m. split.
    * apply Nat.lt_succ_diag_r.
    * assumption.
  + destruct IHm as [IHm1 | IHm2].
    * destruct IHm1 as [n [Hlt HPn]]. 
      left. exists n. split.
      -- apply Nat.lt_le_incl. apply Nat.lt_le_incl in Hlt. apply Nat.le_lt_trans with m; assumption.
      -- assumption.
    * right. intros n Hlt. apply le_lt_or_eq_dec in Hlt as [Hlt' | Heq].
      -- apply IHm2. assumption.
      -- subst. assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros P H m. induction m. - right. intros n Hlt. exfalso. inversion Hlt. - destruct (H m) as [HPm | HnPm]. + left. exists m. split. * apply Nat.lt_succ_diag_r. * auto. + destruct IHm as [IHm1 | IHm2]. * destruct IHm1 as [n [Hlt HPn]]. left. exists n. split. -- apply Nat.lt_le_incl. apply Nat.lt_le_incl in Hlt. apply Nat.le_lt_trans with m; auto. -- auto. * right. intros n Hlt. apply le_lt_or_eq_dec in Hlt as [Hlt' | Heq]. -- apply IHm2. auto. -- subst. auto.
